text: Dr. Helen Patricia Sharman OBE FRSC (born 30 May 1963) is a British chemist. She became the first British astronaut and the first woman to visit the Mir space station in 1993. She worked as a research and development technologist for GEC in London and later as a chemist for Mars Incorporated dealing with nice properties of chocolate. Sharman was born in Grenoside, Sheffield. ==References== Category:1963 births Category:Living people Category:British chemists Category:Astronauts Category:People from Sheffield
